Package org.ejbca.core.ejb.upgrade

Class UpgradeSessionBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ejbca.core.ejb.upgrade.UpgradeSessionBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UpgradeSession, UpgradeSessionLocal, UpgradeSessionRemote
    public class UpgradeSessionBean
extends Object
implements UpgradeSessionLocal, UpgradeSessionRemote
    The upgrade session bean is used to upgrade the database between EJBCA releases.
    Version:
    $Id: UpgradeSessionBean.java 31276 2019-01-21 23:52:29Z jeklund $

      • migrateDatabase624

        public void migrateDatabase624()
                        throws UpgradeFailedException
        EJBCA 6.2.4 introduced default responder configuration in the database.
        Specified by:
        migrateDatabase624 in interface UpgradeSessionLocal
        Throws:
        UpgradeFailedException - if upgrade fails (rolls back)

      • migrateDatabase640

        public void migrateDatabase640()
                        throws UpgradeFailedException
        EJBCA 6.4.0 introduces new sun rules to System Configuration in regards to Custom OIDs and EKUs. Access rules have also been added for read only rights to parts of the GUI.
        Specified by:
        migrateDatabase640 in interface UpgradeSessionLocal
        Throws:
        UpgradeFailedException - if upgrade fails (rolls back)

      • migrateDatabase642

        public void migrateDatabase642()
                        throws UpgradeFailedException
        EJBCA 6.4.2: 1. Adds view rules to System Configuration, EKU Configuration and Certificate Extension Configuration. Any roles with edit rights to those pages, or which match the Auditor role from 6.4.0 will be automatically upgraded. 2. Adds view rules to Roles. Any roles with edit rights roles, or which match the Auditor role from 6.4.0 will be automatically upgraded.
        Specified by:
        migrateDatabase642 in interface UpgradeSessionLocal
        Throws:
        UpgradeFailedException - if upgrade fails (rolls back)

      • migrateDatabase651

        public void migrateDatabase651()
                        throws UpgradeFailedException
        EJBCA 6.5.1: This upgrade only affects CMP aliases: 1. End entity profiles will be referred to by ID instead of by name. In consideration of 100% uptime requirements, the value ra.endentityprofile is replaced by ra.endentityprofileid, allowing legacy configurations to keep using the old value.
        Specified by:
        migrateDatabase651 in interface UpgradeSessionLocal
        Throws:
        UpgradeFailedException - if upgrade fails (rolls back)

      • migrateDatabase660

        public void migrateDatabase660()
                        throws UpgradeFailedException
        EJBCA 6.6.0: 1. Adds new access rules for approval profiles 2. If CA or certificate profiles require Approvals, create a new Approval Profile matching those settings and convert to using that
        Specified by:
        migrateDatabase660 in interface UpgradeSessionLocal
        Throws:
        UpgradeFailedException - if upgrade fails (rolls back)

      • migrateDatabase680

        public void migrateDatabase680()
                        throws UpgradeFailedException
        EJBCA 6.8.0: 1. Converts AdminGroupData, AccessRuleData and AdminEntityData to RoleData and RoleMemberData 2. Migrates /ca_functionality/basic_functions and /ca_functionality/basic_functions/activate_ca to a single rule: /ca_functionality/activate_ca 3. Remove no longer used rules 4. Upgrades CAs and Certificate Profiles to go from having one approval profile for all approval types to having one for each
        Specified by:
        migrateDatabase680 in interface UpgradeSessionLocal
        Throws:
        UpgradeFailedException - if upgrade fails (rolls back)

      • migrateDatabase6101

        public void migrateDatabase6101()
                         throws UpgradeFailedException
        Upgrade to EJBCA 6.10.1. Upgrading System configuration and certificate profiles with CT log label system
        Specified by:
        migrateDatabase6101 in interface UpgradeSessionLocal
        Throws:
        UpgradeFailedException - fail

      • migrateDatabase6110

        public void migrateDatabase6110()
                         throws UpgradeFailedException
        Upgrade to EJBCA 6.11.0 Provides all current Peer connector roles with the new set of rules, controlling access to protocols on remote RA instances. All should be allowed by default to not cause any regressions. The rules are only relevant for RA Peer connector roles.
        Specified by:
        migrateDatabase6110 in interface UpgradeSessionLocal
        Throws:
        UpgradeFailedException - fail

      • migrateDatabase6120

        Upgrades to EJBCA 6.12.0
        Specified by:
        migrateDatabase6120 in interface UpgradeSessionLocal

      • migrateDatabase6140

        public void migrateDatabase6140()
                         throws UpgradeFailedException
        Upgrade to EJBCA 6.14.0 Provides all current Peer connector roles with the new rules, controlling access to SCEP (same procedure as migrateDatabase6110) on remote RA instances. Should be allowed by default to not cause any regressions. This rules is only relevant for RA Peer connector roles.
        Specified by:
        migrateDatabase6140 in interface UpgradeSessionLocal
        Throws:
        UpgradeFailedException - fail

      • migrateDatabase6150

                         throws UpgradeFailedException
        Upgrade to EJBCA 6.15.0 All the CCE will get a new required flag with the default value set to true.
        Specified by:

        Throws:

      • isLesserThan

        public boolean isLesserThan​(String first,
                            String second)
        Description copied from interface: UpgradeSessionLocal
        Takes two versions and compares the first and the second versions to each other Compares the max amount of numbers on both. So 6.1.2.3,6.1.2 will try to compare 4 numbers, adding a 0, i.e. 6.1.2.3,6.1.2.0
        Specified by:
        isLesserThan in interface UpgradeSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        first - a version number
        second - a version number
        Returns:
        true of the first version is lower (1.0 < 2.0) than the second, false otherwise.
